config_description: The amount of time unacknowledged data is allowed on a streaming connection. The default is 5 minutes. Increase it or set it to 0 in order to increase the timeout.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration option 'internode_streaming_tcp_user_timeout_in_ms' is used to set the amount of time unacknowledged data is allowed on a streaming connection. The code snippet provided shows that this configuration is used to check if the processing time of an incoming stream message exceeds the specified timeout value.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'internode_streaming_tcp_user_timeout_in_ms' configuration in the system depends on the processing time of incoming stream messages. If the processing time exceeds the configured timeout value, a warning message is logged.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'internode_streaming_tcp_user_timeout_in_ms' configuration option is that it determines how long unacknowledged data is allowed on a streaming connection. If the timeout value is too low, it may result in premature closing of streaming connections. Increasing the timeout value can help prevent premature closure of connections and improve system stability.
